title.yo: Ìgbáradì fún Ìbímọ̀ àti Ìpèsè Fún Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ Pajáwìrì

description.en: Planning and preparing in advance for safe childbirth, with support from family, community, and health facility.
description.yo: Ìgbáradì ní kétékété fún ìbímọ̀ tó dáa pẹ̀lú ìrànlọ́wọ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ ẹbí, àdúgbò àti ilé ìwòsàn.

en: 1. Attend antenatal visits at least four times during pregnancy in a recognized health facility.
2. Ensure delivery is attended by a skilled health worker (doctor or midwife).
3. Plan the place of delivery and arrange transportation during labour.
4. Prepare all necessary items for the birth.
5. Save money for hospital bills and medication.
6. Recognize the signs of labour.
7. Recognize the danger signs of pregnancy and labour.
8. Identify a potential blood donor.
9. Arrange support for delivery and family care while away.
10. Assign an alternate decision-maker if the primary one is unavailable.
yo: 1. Lọ sí ilé ìwòsàn fún ìtọ́jú oyún ní kéré tán ẹ̀ẹ̀mẹ́rin nígbà oyún.
2. Ṣe ìmúlò ìbímọ̀ níbi tí dókítà tàbí nọọsi agbẹ́bí wà.
3. Ṣètò ibi ìbímọ̀ àti ohun ìrìnàjò tó máa gbé aboyun lọ síbẹ̀.
4. Pèsè gbogbo ohun èlò tó yẹ fún ìbímọ̀.
5. Pèsè owó tó tó fún ilé ìwòsàn àti ogun.
6. Mọ àmì ìrọ̀bí kíákíá.
7. Mọ àwọn àmì ewu oyún àti ìbímọ̀.
8. Ṣètò ẹni tó lè fi ẹ̀jẹ̀ sílẹ̀.
9. Ṣètò ẹni tó máa bá aboyun lọ àti ẹni tó máa bójú tó ìdílé.
10. Yan ẹni míì tó lè gbé ìpinnu báyìí tí olórí kò bá sí.

description.en: Good nutrition before, during, and after pregnancy is essential for the health of both mother and child.
description.yo: Oúnjẹ tó péye ṣáájú oyún, nígbà oyún àti lẹ́yìn ìbímọ̀ jẹ́ pàtàkì fún ìlera ìyá àti ọmọ.

en: 1. Eat fresh foods with all classes of nutrients (proteins, carbohydrates, fats, oils) at every meal.
2. Eat vegetables and fruits regularly for vitamins and minerals.
3. Eat iron-rich foods such as vegetables, liver, egg, and milk to prevent anaemia.
4. Eat calcium-rich foods (milk, yoghurt, cheese, seafood) for strong bones and teeth.
5. Eat green leafy and yellow vegetables for healthy skin, bones, and eyes.
6. Eat iodine-rich foods (seafood, iodized salt) for brain development.
7. Eat salty foods in moderation to prevent bloating and water retention.
8. Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily to reduce constipation and prevent infections.
9. Take supplements such as folic acid, ferrous sulphate, and vitamin C.
yo: 1. Jẹ oúnjẹ pẹ̀lú gbogbo eroja asàràlórè (àmìno, kariboháidireeti, ọra) ní gbogbo onjẹ.
2. Máa jẹ́ ẹ̀fọ́ àti èso déédé fún vitamin àti mínerà.
3. Máa jẹ́ ẹdọ, ẹyin àti wara láti déná àìtó ẹ̀jẹ̀.
4. Máa jẹ́ wara, yogọ́ọ̀tì, àrọ̀kẹ́sẹ̀ àti ẹja okun fún egungun àti eyín.
5. Máa jẹ́ ẹ̀fọ́ aláwọ̀ ewé àti aláwọ̀ yíyẹ fún awọ̀, egungun àti ojú.
6. Máa jẹ́ ẹja okun àti iyọ̀ tó ní iodini fún ọpọlọ ọmọ.
7. Máa jẹun iyọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìṣọ́ra kí kò fa ìdíwú.
8. Máa mu omi tó pọ̀ (bó kere tán ìfé méjọ lójoojúmọ́) kí igbé rọrùn, kí a sì déná àrùn.
9. Máa lo oogun àfikún bí folic acid, ferrous sulphate àti vitamin C.

description.en: Family planning helps individuals or couples decide the number and spacing of their children responsibly.
description.yo: Ìfètò sómo bíbí ń ràn àwọn tọkọtaya lọ́wọ́ láti ṣètò iye àti àsìkò ọmọ tí wọ́n fẹ́ bí.

en: Benefits of Family Planning:
1. Reduces maternal deaths from childbirth complications.
2. Gives mothers time to recover fully between pregnancies.
3. Decreases complications in the next pregnancy and delivery.
4. Reduces risk of unwanted pregnancy.
5. Improves educational opportunities for women.
6. Reduces financial burden on families.
Types of Family Planning:
1. Natural Methods – exclusive breastfeeding, calendar methods, abstinence, cycle beads.
2. Barrier Methods – male/female condom, diaphragm, spermicide, foaming tablets.
3. Hormonal Methods – injectables, oral contraceptives, implants.
4. Intrauterine Contraceptive Device (IUCD).
5. Permanent Methods – tubal ligation, vasectomy.
yo: Àǹfàní Ìfètò Sómo Bíbí:
1. Dín ìkú abiyamọ̀ kù látàrí ìṣòro ìbímọ̀.
2. Fún abiyamọ̀ ní àyè láti sinmi kí ó tó lóyún míràn.
3. Dínkù ewu nínú oyún àti ìbímọ̀ tó tẹ̀lé.
4. Dín ìṣèlẹ̀ oyún àìròtẹ́lẹ̀ kù.
5. Ṣí ànfàní ẹ̀kọ́ fún obìnrin.
6. Dín ìnáwó ìdílé kù.
Oríṣìíríṣìí Ìfètò Sómo Bíbí:
1. Amútòrunwá – fífún ọmọ lòyàn déédé, àìní ìbalòpọ̀, lílo kalẹ́ńdà, ìlẹ̀kẹ́ ìfètò.
2. Ìdábòbò – lílo rọ́bà fún ọkùnrin àti obìnrin.
3. Ìlànà Homónà – abẹrẹ, tabulẹti, ìmùpọ̀.
4. IUCD.
5. Ìṣè abẹ́ àlásọ́pá – tubal ligation àti vasectomy.

description.en: Breastfeeding exclusively for six months provides ideal food, protection from illness, and promotes mother-child bonding.
description.yo: Fífún ọmọ lòyàn fún oṣù mẹ́fà kọ́ lóúnjẹ tó péye, ó sì dènà àrùn àti mú ìbáṣepọ̀ tó lágbára láàrín ìyá àti ọmọ.

en: 1. Ensure the baby takes the first yellow milk (colostrum); it protects against diseases.
2. Breast milk alone is enough for six months — no need for water or other food.
3. Breastfeeding is economical and convenient.
4. Promotes strong bonding between mother and child.
5. Breast milk is safe, free, and always available.
6. Breastfed babies are healthier and more lively.
7. Protects against dangerous illnesses.
8. Essential for brain development and improves IQ.
9. Reduces diarrhea and colic.
10. Lowers risk of allergies like asthma later in life.
11. Helps shrink the womb after delivery.
12. Acts as natural family planning when done exclusively.
yo: 1. Jẹ́ kí ọmọ mú omi aláwọ̀ pupa (colostrum) tó kọ́kọ́ jáde; ó ń dènà àrùn.
2. Omi ọmú nìkan tó fún oṣù mẹ́fà — kò nílò omi tàbí onjẹ míràn.
3. Fífún ọmọ lòyàn kò na ní lọ́wọ́, ó sì rọrùn.
4. Jẹ́ kí ìfẹ́ wà láàrín ìyá àti ọmọ.
5. Omi ọmú dájú, rọrùn, kò sì sanwó.
6. Ọmọ tí a fún lòyàn máa ní ilera dáadáa.
7. Dènà àrùn tó lèwu.
8. Pàtàkì fún ìdàgbàsókè ọpọlọ àti ìmúlò IQ.
9. Dín ìgbẹ́ gbuuru àti ìnù rirun kù.
10. Dín àìlera bíi asima ní ọjọ́ iwájú.
11. Ràn lọ́wọ́ kí ile-ìyá padà sí ipo lẹ́yìn ìbímọ̀.
12. Ṣíṣe ìfètò oyún àdánidá bí a bá fi omi ọmú nìkan fún.

title.yo: Àwọn Àmi Tó Lèwu Nígbà Oyún

description.en: If you notice any of these signs during pregnancy, seek medical help immediately.
description.yo: Tí o bá ṣàkíyèsí àwọn àmì wọ̀nyí nígbà oyún, lọ sí ilé ìwòsàn lẹ́sẹ̀kẹsẹ̀.

en: 1. Fever.
2. Excessive weakness.
3. Severe headache or blurred vision.
4. Convulsions.
5. Severe abdominal pain.
6. Swelling of the feet, hands, or face.
7. Reduced or no movement of the baby.
8. Leakage of fluid from the vagina.
9. Foul-smelling vaginal discharge.
10. Vaginal bleeding or spotting.
11. Lower abdominal pain before 37 weeks.
12. Excessive weight gain.
13. Shortness of breath.
14. Severe diarrhoea or vomiting.
yo: 1. Ara gbígbóná tàbí ìbà.
2. Àìlera púpọ̀.
3. Èforí tó pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ojú ṣíṣù.
4. Àrùn gírì (ìṣùrù).
5. Ìnù rírùn tó pọ̀.
6. Ìwúpọ̀ ẹsẹ̀, ọwọ́ tàbí ojú.
7. Ìdínkù tàbí àìní ìrìn ọmọ nínú oyún.
8. Ìṣàn omi láti inú obo.
9. Ìṣàn obo tó ń run.
10. Ìṣàn ẹ̀jẹ̀ láti inú obo.
11. Ìrora ní abẹ́-ìfun kí oyún tó pé ọ̀sẹ̀ 37.
12. Ìwọ̀n ara tó pọ̀jù.
13. Àìlémí kánlẹ̀.
14. Ìgbẹ́ gbúùrú tàbí ẹ̀ébì tó pọ̀.

title.en: 10 Steps to Safe Pregnancy and Healthy Baby
title.yo: Ìgbésẹ̀ Mẹ́wàá Fún Oyún Aláàbò àti Ọmọ Aláàfíà

description.en: Every woman should know these essential steps for a safe pregnancy and a healthy baby.
description.yo: Gbogbo obìnrin gbọ́dọ̀ mọ àwọn ìlànà wọ̀nyí fún oyún aláàbò àti ọmọ aláàfíà.

en: 1. When and how to prepare for pregnancy and delivery.
2. Eat adequate diet before pregnancy and at all times.
3. Learn important facts about pregnancy and delivery.
4. Attend antenatal clinic at least four times; receive malaria prevention, folic acid, blood tablets, vitamin C, and tetanus toxoid.
5. Sleep under insecticide-treated nets (ITNs) throughout pregnancy and with the baby.
6. Understand Expected Date of Delivery (EDD) and plan with skilled health workers.
7. Recognize the danger signs of pregnancy and labour.
8. Save enough money and arrange transportation for delivery.
9. Understand the importance of exclusive breastfeeding and postnatal care.
10. Discuss family planning services with health workers.
yo: 1. Àsìkò àti ìlànà láti pèsè fún oyún àti ìbímọ̀.
2. Jẹ oúnjẹ àṣàràlórè ṣáájú oyún, nígbà oyún àti lẹ́yìn ìbímọ̀.
3. Kọ́ ẹ̀kọ́ nípa oyún àti ìbímọ̀.
4. Lọ sí ìtọ́jú oyún ní kéré tán ẹ̀ẹ̀mẹ́rin, kí o sì gba oogun ibà, folic acid, ọ̀gùn ẹ̀jẹ̀, vitamin C àti abẹrẹ tetanus.
5. Sùn lábẹ́ àpò ẹ̀fọ̀n (ITN) ní gbogbo oyún àti pẹ̀lú ọmọ.
6. Mọ ọjọ́ ìbímọ̀ tó yẹ (EDD) àti ṣètò pẹ̀lú dókítà tàbí nọọsi agbẹ́bí.
7. Mọ àwọn àmì ewu oyún àti ìbímọ̀.
8. Pèsè owó tó tó àti ṣètò irinàjò lọ sí ilé ìwòsàn.
9. Mọ pàtàkì fífún ọmọ lòyàn àti ìtọju lẹ́yìn ìbímọ̀.
10. Ṣe ìjíròrò pẹ̀lú alágbàṣepọ̀ ilera nípa ìfètò sómo bíbí.
